Description: Ostracon, section (three fragments joined) of the body of a orange-red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse with many white and metallic inclusions and partially mauve in section, the exterior is slightly grooved, covered with a self-slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394663) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394663)
